metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2824 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the trapper command functionality of Zabbix Server 2.4.X. A specially crafted set of packets can cause a command injection resulting in remote code execution. An attacker can make requests from an active Zabbix Proxy to trigger this vulnerability. It was discovered that Zabbix incorrectly handled certain requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:3.0.7+dfsg-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.0.7+dfsg-3').
